title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
Welcome!
I hope you’re having a great day!

title: Betsy Church
text:
https://linkedin.com
https://github.com
Betsy Church is a Graduate Student at University of Idaho. Current research project is about the potential effects that a Staph. aureus infection may have on the tissue and secretion microbiomes of artificially induced lactation in heifers. When not in the lab, she can be found crocheting, watching medical drama on tv, or playing video games. Often times, her dog Finn or Cat Olivander can be found snuggled in her lap.

title: Betsy Church
text:
Education
University of Idaho | Moscow, ID
PhD in Nutrition Sciences | August 2023- Present
Weber State University | Ogden, UT
Bachelor of Science in Microbiology | August 2016- April 2021

title: “ASSIGNMENT 4”
text:
Figure. 1
This figure shows the data in a way that expresses everything it needs to express, which is the mean percentage of infants breastfeeding at 6 months of age over the 3 years. The figure also is effective because the information is easy to see and in the appropriate form.


Code
##figure 1
library(tidyverse)


Warning: package 'tidyverse' was built under R version 4.4.2


Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.4.2


Warning: package 'tidyr' was built under R version 4.4.2


Warning: package 'readr' was built under R version 4.4.2


Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 4.4.2


Warning: package 'forcats' was built under R version 4.4.2


Warning: package 'lubridate' was built under R version 4.4.2


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors


Code
 BSBC.Data..BF.and.mPINC.over.3.reports <- read.csv("C:/Users/betsy/OneDrive/Desktop/Master's Degree/BSBC Data. BF and mPINC over 3 reports.csv")
View(BSBC.Data..BF.and.mPINC.over.3.reports)

 df_long <- BSBC.Data..BF.and.mPINC.over.3.reports %>%
  rename(BF.at.6.months.2022=BF.at.6.months..2022) %>%
  select(State,BF.at.6.months.2018, BF.at.6.months.2020, BF.at.6.months.2022) %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = c(BF.at.6.months.2018, BF.at.6.months.2020, BF.at.6.months.2022),  # Replace with your column names
    names_to = "year",
    values_to = "BF", 
    names_prefix = "BF.at.6.months."
  )
 
 ggplot(data=df_long, aes(y=BF, x=year)) +
  geom_boxplot() + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  labs( title = " Figure One:Distribution of BF by Year", x = "Year", y = "Breastfeeding at 6 months (percent)" )









Figure 2. What needs to be expressed here is expressed; Rates of breastfeeding at 6 months by state and it adds in years… However, the effectiveness is horrible. There is way too much going on and it is hard to follow and determine what is what. It really needs to be separate graphs, or separated by region instead of state or something to make it more clear and concise.


Code
ggplot(df_long, aes(x=State,y=BF))+
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", aes(fill=State, alpha=year)) +
  xlab("State") +
  ylab("BF Rate at 6 months (percent") +
  ggtitle("BF rate by state") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, vjust = 0.5, size = 0.1),
        legend.position = "right")


Warning: Using alpha for a discrete variable is not advised.
